&#96;--color-foreground&#96; |\n| Value Display | Monospace, &#96;--font-size-caption&#96;, &#96;--color-brand&#96; |\n| Track | Height 8px, &#96;--color-border&#96;, full radius |\n| Thumb | Accent color: &#96;--color-brand&#96; |\n| **CSS Variable Label** | Below slider |\n| **CSS Variable Font** | &#96;--font-size-caption&#96;, &#96;--color-muted&#96; |\n| **Variable Name** | Monospace, &#96;--color-brand&#96; |\n\n---\n\n### 2.5 Typography Scale Control\n\n**Purpose:** Select type scale ratio and base font Chain Node Spec:**\n\n| Layer | Dot Color | Line Color | Label Color |\n|-------|-----------|------------|-------------|\n| Component | &#96;--color-brand&#96; | Gradient brandâ†’secondary | &#96;--color-brand&#96; |\n| Semantic | &#96;var(--color-secondary)&#96; | Gradient secondaryâ†’blue | &#96;var(--color-secondary)&#96; |\n| Primitive | &#96;#3b82f6&#96; (Blue) | Solid blue | &#96;#3b82f6&#96; |\n| Resolved | None | None | &#96;--color-muted&#96; |\n\n**Node Box Spec:**\n\n| Property | Value |\n|----------|-------|\n| Background | &#96;rgba(31, 41, 55, 0.8)&#96; |\n| Border Radius | &#96;--radius-lg&#96; |\n| Padding | &#96;--spacing-3&#96; |\n| Label | Uppercase, &#96;--font-size-caption&#96;, tracking wider |\n| Token Name | Monospace, &#96;--font-size-body-small&#96;, &#96;--color-foreground&#96; |\n| Sublabel | &#96;--font-size-caption&#96;, &#96;--color-muted&#96; |\n\n**Affected Components List Spec:**\n\n| Property | Value |\n|----------|-------|\n| Item Background | &#96;rgba(31, 41, 55, 0.5)&#96; |\n| Item Background (hover) | &#96;--color-surface-dark&#96; |\n| Item Border Radius | &#96;--radius-lg&#96; |\n| Item Padding | &#96;--spacing-2 --spacing-3&#96; |\n| Dot | 8Ã—8px, &#96;--color-brand&#96;, rounded full |\n| Text | &#96;--font-size-body-small&#96;, &#96;--color-foreground&#96; |\n\n---\n\n## 3. Token Display Standards\n\n### 3.1 CSS Variable Display Rules\n\n**EVERY control that affects a CSS variable MUST display that variable.**\n\n| Control Type | Display Location | Format |\n|--------------|------------------|--------|\n| Color Picker | Below shade selector | &#96;CSS Variable: var(--{name})&#96; |\n| Neutral Scale | Below options | &#96;Affects: var(--color-background), ...&#96; |\n| Radius Slider | Below each slider | &#96;CSS: --radius-{component}&#96; |\n| Typography Scale | In preview | &#96;(--font-size-{name}: {value})&#96; |\n\n### 3.2 Variable Display Component\n\nCreate a reusable &#96;&lt;TokenVariableInfo /&gt;&#96; component:\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\ninterface TokenVariableInfoProps {\n  label?: string;           // \"CSS Variable:\" or \"Affects:\" or \"CSS:\"\n  variables: string[];      // [\"--color-brand\", \"--color-brand-hover\"]\n  variant?: 'single' | 'list';  // Display format\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**Single Variant:**\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\nCSS Variable: --color-brand\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**List Variant:**\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\nAffects:\n  --color-background\n  --color-background-alt\n  --color-text-foreground\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n**Style:**\n- Container: &#96;--color-surface-dark&#96; bg, &#96;--radius-lg&#96;, &#96;--spacing-2&#96; padding\n- Label: &#96;--font-size-caption&#96;, &#96;--color-muted&#96;\n- Variable: Monospace, &#96;--color-brand&#96;\n\n---\n\n## 4. Style Constraints\n\n### 4.1 Color Usage (from styleguide.md)\n\n| Purpose | Color | Token |\n|---------|-------|-------|\n| Interactive elements, key values | Teal | &#96;var(--color-brand)&#96; |\n| Structural elements, icons | Deep Purple | &#96;var(--color-secondary)&#96; |\n| Labels, descriptions | Gray | &#96;var(--color-muted)&#96; |\n| Primary text | Near black | &#96;var(--color-foreground)&#96; |\n\n### 4.2 Typography\n\n| Element | Size | Weight | Color |\n|---------|------|--------|-------|\n| Panel title | &#96;--font-size-body-small&#96; | 600 | &#96;--color-muted&#96; (uppercase) |\n| Section header | &#96;--font-size-body&#96; | 500 | &#96;--color-foreground&#96; |\n| Control label | &#96;--font-size-body-small&#96; | 500 | &#96;--color-foreground&#96; |\n| Value display | &#96;--font-size-caption&#96; | 400 | &#96;--color-brand&#96; (mono) |\n| Help text | &#96;--font-size-caption&#96; | 400 | &#96;--color-muted&#96; |\n\n### 4.3 Spacing\n\n| Context | Value |\n|---------|-------|\n| Panel padding | &#96;--spacing-4&#96; |\n| Section gap | &#96;--spacing-4&#96; |\n| Control gap | &#96;--spacing-3&#96; |\n| Inner element gap | &#96;--spacing-2&#96; |\n| Grid gap | &#96;--spacing-2&#96; |\n\n### 4.4 Border Radius\n\n| Context | Value |\n|---------|-------|\n| Panel/Section | &#96;--radius-xl&#96; (12px) |\n| Controls, Inputs | &#96;--radius-lg&#96; (8px) |\n| Small elements | &#96;--radius-md&#96; (6px) |\n| Swatches | 4px |\n\n---\n\n## 5. Interaction Patterns\n\n### 5.1 Panel Collapse/Expand\n\n- **Trigger:** Click entire header row\n- **Animation:** &#96;max-height&#96; transition 300ms ease-out, &#96;opacity&#96; 200ms\n- **Chevron:** Rotates 180Â° when collapsed\n- **Default state:** Colors and Radius expanded, Typography collapsed\n\n### 5.2 Color Swatch Selection\n\n- **Hover:** &#96;scale(1.1)&#96;, subtle shadow\n- **Selected:** &#96;scale(1.15)&#96;, ring: &#96;0 0 0 2px white, 0 0 0 4px var(--color-brand)&#96;\n- **Click:** Immediate update, no animation needed\n\n### 5.3 Slider Interaction\n\n- **Drag:** Real-time preview updates\n- **Debounce:** None needed for CSS variable updates\n- **Value display:** Updates immediately with drag\n\n### 5.4 Preview Element Inspection\n\n- **Hover:** Subtle outline, cursor: pointer\n- **Click:** \n  1. Highlight element in preview (pulse animation 1.5s)\n  2. Update Inspector panel with token chain\n  3. Scroll Inspector to top if needed\n- **Clear:** Click empty area or different element\n\n---\n\n## 6. Data Flow\n\n### 6.1 State Structure\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\ninterface ThemeGeneratorState {\n  // Colors\n  brandColor: {\n    family: ColorFamily;\n    shade: Shade;\n  };\n  secondaryColor: {\n    family: ColorFamily;\n    shade: Shade;\n  };\n  neutralScale: NeutralFamily;\n  \n  // Radius\n  radiusPreset: 'sharp' | 'default' | 'rounded' | 'pill';\n  radiusValues: {\n    button: number;\n    card: number;\n    input: number;\n    badge: number;\n  };\n  \n  // Typography\n  typeScale: 'ms' | 'mt';\n  baseFontSize: number;\n  \n  // Preview\n  previewMode: 'light' | 'dark';\n  previewDevice: 'desktop' | 'tablet' | 'mobile';\n  \n  // Inspector\n  selectedElement: string | null;\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n### 6.2 CSS Variable Updates\n\nOn any state change:\n1. Calculate new resolved values\n2. Update CSS custom properties via &#96;document.documentElement.style.setProperty()&#96;\n3. Preview updates automatically via CSS variable inheritance\n\n### 6.3 Token Resolution\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n// Example: Brand color change\nconst newBrandColor = primitives.colors[family][shade];\ndocument.documentElement.style.setProperty('--color-brand', newBrandColor);\ndocument.documentElement.style.setProperty('--button-bg', 'var(--color-brand)');\n// etc.\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n---\n\n## 7. Appendix A: Component Prop Interfaces\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\n// CollapsibleSection\ninterface CollapsibleSectionProps {\n  id: string;\n  title: string;\n  icon: React.ComponentType;\n  iconGradient: string;\n  defaultExpanded?: boolean;\n  children: React.ReactNode;\n}\n\n// ColorPickerControl\ninterface ColorPickerControlProps {\n  label: string;\n  cssVariable: string;\n  family: ColorFamily;\n  shade: Shade;\n  onFamilyChange: (family: ColorFamily) =&gt; void;\n  onShadeChange: (shade: Shade) =&gt; void;\n}\n\n// NeutralScaleControl\ninterface NeutralScaleControlProps {\n  selected: NeutralFamily;\n  onChange: (family: NeutralFamily) =&gt; void;\n  affectedVariables: string[];\n}\n\n// RadiusControl\ninterface RadiusControlProps {\n  preset: RadiusPreset;\n  values: RadiusValues;\n  onPresetChange: (preset: RadiusPreset) =&gt; void;\n  onValueChange: (key: keyof RadiusValues, value: number) =&gt; void;\n}\n\n// TokenVariableInfo\ninterface TokenVariableInfoProps {\n  label?: string;\n  variables: string[];\n  variant?: 'single' | 'list';\n}\n\n// TokenChainVisualizer\ninterface TokenChainVisualizerProps {\n  chain: TokenChainNode[];\n  resolvedValue: string;\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n---\n\n## Appendix B: File Structure\n\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\nsrc/\nâ”œâ”€â”€ app/\nâ”‚   â””â”€â”€ generator/\nâ”‚       â””â”€â”€ page.tsx                    # Main theme Educational Visualization\n**Goal**: Help users build a mental model of the token system architecture.\n\n- **Token Flow Diagram**: Visual representation showing how a hex value flows through layers\n- **Cascade Highlighting**: When a semantic color is selected, highlight which components inherit from it\n- **Reference Tracing**: Click any component to see its full token reference chain\n\n### 2. Color Palette Builder\n**Goal**: Enable users to create harmonious palettes using the primitive color library.\n\n#### Semantic Color Mapping\nFor each semantic color slot (Brand, Secondary, Background, etc.):\n- **Primitive Picker**: Dropdown to select base color group (Blue, Emerald, Violet, etc.)\n- **Shade Slider**: Adjust between shades (50-950) with visual feedback\n- **Color Preview**: Live swatch showing selected color with hex/CSS variable\n\n#### Supported Semantic Slots\n- &#96;Brand&#96; (Default, Hover, Light, Dark)\n- &#96;Secondary&#96; (Default, Hover, Light)\n- &#96;Background&#96; (Default, Alt)\n- &#96;Surface&#96;\n- &#96;Text&#96; (Foreground, Muted, Subtle)\n- &#96;Border&#96; (Default, Strong)\n- &#96;Status&#96; (Success, Warning, Error, Info)\n\n### 3. const panel = document.getElementById(panelId + '-panel');\n      const chevron = document.getElementById(panelId + '-chevron');\n      \n      if (panel.classList.contains('collapsed')) {\n        panel.classList.remove('collapsed');\n        panel.style.maxHeight = panel.scrollHeight + 'px';\n        chevron.classList.remove('rotate-180');\n      } else {\n        panel.classList.add('collapsed');\n        panel.style.maxHeight = '0';\n        chevron.classList.add('rotate-180');\n      }\n    }\n\n    // Initialize panels (colors and radius open, typography closed)\n    document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {\n      const colorsPanel = document.getElementById('colors-panel');\n      const radiusPanel = document.getElementById('radius-panel');\n      \n      colorsPanel.style.maxHeight = colorsPanel.scrollHeight + 'px';\n      radiusPanel.style.maxHeight = radiusPanel.scrollHeight + 'px';\n    });\n\n    // Demo: Color swatch selection\n    document.querySelectorAll('.color-swatch').forEach(swatch =&gt; {\n      swatch.addEventListener('click', function() {\n        // Remove selected from siblings\n        this.parentElement.querySelectorAll('.color-swatch').forEach(s =&gt; s.classList.remove('selected'));\n        // Add selected to clicked\n        this.classList.add('selected');\n      });\n    });\n  &lt;/script&gt;\n  \n&lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n",

{
  "contents": "/**\n * Token Reference Resolver\n * \n * Resolves token references to their final primitive values.\n * Handles nested references and circular reference detection.\n */\n\nimport {\n  ParsedToken,\n  TokenWithChain,\n  ReferenceChain,\n  ReferenceChainStep,\n  isTokenReference,\n} from '../types';\nimport {\n  parseAllTokens,\n  createTokenLookup,\n} from './parser';\n\n// =============================================================================\n// REFERENCE PARSING\n// =============================================================================\n\n/** Parse a token reference string into its components */\nexport interface ParsedReference {\n  /** Full reference string without braces */\n  fullPath: string;\n  /** Collection name */\n  collection: string;\n  /** Mode name */\n  mode: string;\n  /** Token path within the mode */\n  tokenPath: string;\n}\n\n/** Parse a reference string like {Collection.modes.Mode.Path.To.Token} */\nexport function parseReference(reference: string): ParsedReference | null {\n  // Remove braces\n  const match = reference.match(/^\\{(.+)\\}$/);\n  if (!match) return null;\n  \n  const fullPath = match[1];\n  \n  // Parse the path: Collection.modes.Mode.Path.To.Token\n  // or: Collection.Mode.Path.To.Token (shorthand)\n  const parts = fullPath.split('.');\n  \n  if (parts.length &lt; 3) return null;\n  \n  let collection: string;\n  let mode: string;\n  let tokenPath: string;\n  \n  if (parts[1] === 'modes') {\n    // Full format: Collection.modes.Mode.Path.To.Token\n    collection = parts[0];\n    mode = parts[2];\n    tokenPath = parts.slice(3).join('.');\n  } else {\n    // Shorthand: Collection.Mode.Path.To.Token\n    collection = parts[0];\n    mode = parts[1];\n    tokenPath = parts.slice(2).join('.');\n  }\n  \n  return {\n    fullPath,\n    collection,\n    mode,\n    tokenPath,\n  };\n}\n\n/** Build the full reference path for a token */\nexport function buildReferencePath(token: ParsedToken): string {\n  return &#96;{${token.collection}.modes.${token.mode}.${token.path}}&#96;;\n}\n\n// =============================================================================\n// TOKEN LOOKUP\n// =============================================================================\n\n/** Cached token lookup map */\nlet tokenLookupCache: Map&lt;string, ParsedToken&gt; | null = null;\nlet allTokensCache: ParsedToken[] | null = null;\n\n/** Get or create the token lookup cache */\nfunction getTokenLookup(): Map&lt;string, ParsedToken&gt; {\n  if (!tokenLookupCache) {\n    allTokensCache = parseAllTokens();\n    tokenLookupCache = createTokenLookup(allTokensCache);\n  }\n  return tokenLookupCache;\n}\n\n/** Get all cached tokens */\nfunction getAllTokens(): ParsedToken[] {\n  if (!allTokensCache) {\n    getTokenLookup(); // This will populate the cache\n  }\n  return allTokensCache!;\n}\n\n/** Clear the token cache (useful for testing or reloading) */\nexport function clearTokenCache(): void {\n  tokenLookupCache = null;\n  allTokensCache = null;\n}\n\n/** Find a token by its reference string */\nexport function findToken(reference: string): ParsedToken | undefined {\n  const parsed = parseReference(reference);\n  if (!parsed) return undefined;\n  \n  const lookup = getTokenLookup();\n  \n  // Try full path format\n  const fullPath = &#96;${parsed.collection}.modes.${parsed.mode}.${parsed.tokenPath}&#96;;\n  let token = lookup.get(fullPath);\n  \n  if (!token) {\n    // Try shorthand format\n    const shortPath = &#96;${parsed.collection}.${parsed.mode}.${parsed.tokenPath}&#96;;\n    token = lookup.get(shortPath);\n  }\n  \n  return token;\n}\n\n// =============================================================================\n// REFERENCE RESOLUTION\n// =============================================================================\n\n/** Maximum depth for reference resolution (prevent infinite loops) */\nconst MAX_RESOLUTION_DEPTH = 10;\n\n/** \n * Resolve a token reference to its final value\n * Returns the resolved value and the chain of tokens traversed\n */\nexport function resolveReference(\n  reference: string,\n  depth: number = 0,\n  visited: Set&lt;string&gt; = new Set()\n): { value: string | number; chain: ParsedToken[] } | null {\n  // Check for circular references\n  if (visited.has(reference)) {\n    console.warn(&#96;Circular reference detected: ${reference}&#96;);\n    return null;\n  }\n  \n  // Check max depth\n  if (depth &gt; MAX_RESOLUTION_DEPTH) {\n    console.warn(&#96;Max resolution depth exceeded for: ${reference}&#96;);\n    return null;\n  }\n  \n  const token = findToken(reference);\n  if (!token) {\n    console.warn(&#96;Token not found for reference: ${reference}&#96;);\n    return null;\n  }\n  \n  visited.add(reference);\n  \n  // If this token has a reference, resolve it recursively\n  if (token.reference) {\n    const resolved = resolveReference(token.reference, depth + 1, visited);\n    if (resolved) {\n      return {\n        value: resolved.value,\n        chain: [token, ...resolved.chain],\n      };\n    }\n    return null;\n  }\n  \n  // This is a primitive value\n  return {\n    value: token.value,\n    chain: [token],\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Resolve a single token's value\n * Returns the final resolved value\n */\nexport function resolveTokenValue(token: ParsedToken): string | number {\n  if (!token.reference) {\n    return token.value;\n  }\n  \n  const resolved = resolveReference(token.reference);\n  return resolved ? resolved.value : token.value;\n}\n\n/**\n * Resolve all references in an array of tokens\n * Returns new tokens with resolved values\n */\nexport function resolveAllTokens(tokens: ParsedToken[]): ParsedToken[] {\n  return tokens.map(token =&gt; ({\n    ...token,\n    value: resolveTokenValue(token),\n  }));\n}\n\n// =============================================================================\n// REFERENCE CHAIN BUILDING\n// =============================================================================\n\n/**\n * Build a complete reference chain for a token\n */\nexport function buildReferenceChain(token: ParsedToken): ReferenceChain {\n  const steps: ReferenceChainStep[] = [];\n  let currentToken = token;\n  let depth = 0;\n  const visited = new Set&lt;string&gt;();\n  \n  while (currentToken) {\n    const ref = buildReferencePath(currentToken);\n    \n    // Prevent infinite loops\n    if (visited.has(ref)) {\n      break;\n    }\n    visited.add(ref);\n    \n    const isFinal = !currentToken.reference;\n    \n    steps.push({\n      token: currentToken,\n      depth,\n      isFinal,\n    });\n    \n    if (currentToken.reference) {\n      const nextToken = findToken(currentToken.reference);\n      if (nextToken) {\n        currentToken = nextToken;\n        depth++;\n      } else {\n        break;\n      }\n    } else {\n      break;\n    }\n    \n    // Safety limit\n    if (depth &gt; MAX_RESOLUTION_DEPTH) {\n      break;\n    }\n  }\n  \n  const finalStep = steps[steps.length - 1];\n  \n  return {\n    source: token,\n    steps,\n    resolvedValue: finalStep?.token.value ?? token.value,\n    depth: steps.length - 1,\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Get tokens that reference a specific token (reverse lookup)\n */\nexport function getReferencingTokens(token: ParsedToken): ParsedToken[] {\n  const targetRef = buildReferencePath(token);\n  const allTokens = getAllTokens();\n  \n  return allTokens.filter(t =&gt; t.reference === targetRef);\n}\n\n/**\n * Create a TokenWithChain from a ParsedToken\n */\nexport function enrichTokenWithChain(token: ParsedToken): TokenWithChain {\n  const chain = buildReferenceChain(token);\n  const referencedBy = getReferencingTokens(token);\n  \n  return {\n    ...token,\n    value: chain.resolvedValue,\n    referenceChain: chain.steps.map(s =&gt; s.token),\n    referencedBy,\n  };\n}\n\n/**\n * Enrich multiple tokens with their reference chains\n */\nexport function enrichTokensWithChains(tokens: ParsedToken[]): TokenWithChain[] {\n  return tokens.map(enrichTokenWithChain);\n}\n\n// =============================================================================\n// DEPENDENCY ANALYSIS\n// =============================================================================\n\n/**\n * Get all tokens that a given token depends on (directly or indirectly)\n */\nexport function getDependencies(token: ParsedToken): ParsedToken[] {\n  const chain = buildReferenceChain(token);\n  // Exclude the source token itself\n  return chain.steps.slice(1).map(s =&gt; s.token);\n}\n\n/**\n * Get all tokens that depend on a given token (directly or indirectly)\n */\nexport function getDependents(token: ParsedToken): ParsedToken[] {\n  const dependents: ParsedToken[] = [];\n  const visited = new Set&lt;string&gt;();\n  const queue = [token];\n  \n  while (queue.length &gt; 0) {\n    const current = queue.shift()!;\n    const ref = buildReferencePath(current);\n    \n    if (visited.has(ref)) continue;\n    visited.add(ref);\n    \n    const referencers = getReferencingTokens(current);\n    for (const referencer of referencers) {\n      if (!visited.has(buildReferencePath(referencer))) {\n        dependents.push(referencer);\n        queue.push(referencer);\n      }\n    }\n  }\n  \n  return dependents;\n}\n\n/**\n * Check if changing a token would affect another token\n */\nexport function wouldAffect(sourceToken: ParsedToken, targetToken: ParsedToken): boolean {\n  const dependents = getDependents(sourceToken);\n  const targetRef = buildReferencePath(targetToken);\n  return dependents.some(d =&gt; buildReferencePath(d) === targetRef);\n}\n\n// =============================================================================\n// RESOLUTION UTILITIES\n// =============================================================================\n\n/**\n * Resolve a CSS variable value from a reference\n */\nexport function resolveToCSS(reference: string): string | null {\n  const resolved = resolveReference(reference);\n  if (!resolved) return null;\n  \n  const value = resolved.value;\n  \n  // Format based on type\n  if (typeof value === 'number') {\n    // Check if it looks like a pixel value\n    const token = resolved.chain[resolved.chain.length - 1];\n    if (token.path.includes('Spacing') || token.path.includes('Size') || \n        token.path.includes('Radius') || token.path.includes('Layout')) {\n      return &#96;${value}px&#96;;\n    }\n    if (token.path.includes('Duration')) {\n      return &#96;${value}ms&#96;;\n    }\n    if (token.path.includes('FontWeight')) {\n      return String(value);\n    }\n    if (token.path.includes('LineHeight')) {\n      return String(value);\n    }\n    return String(value);\n  }\n  \n  return value;\n}\n\n/**\n * Get the primitive source for any token\n */\nexport function getPrimitiveSource(token: ParsedToken): ParsedToken | null {\n  const chain = buildReferenceChain(token);\n  const finalStep = chain.steps[chain.steps.length - 1];\n  return finalStep?.token ?? null;\n}\n\n/**\n * Format a resolved value for display\n */\nexport function formatResolvedValue(value: string | number, type: string): string {\n  if (typeof value === 'number') {\n    if (type === 'color') return String(value);\n    return &#96;${value}&#96;;\n  }\n  return value;\n}\n",
